item.title: Large quantity of gas canisters dumped, 2nd January
item.description:
A large quantity of nitrus oxide has been dumped in Albemarle gate. On the grass near number 16 . . There are some recycling bins on the grass that are for the use of residents with no curb side collection. A carrier bag and large box and some loose. . The land here is supposed to be kept by hiways. But they have been neglecting it for a few years. And this area is attracting fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Cleevelands Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 potholes in close proximity, 2nd January
item.description:
Potholes are roughly 40x25x7cm outside number 6 Albany Road and 20x20x5 cm outside number 4. Issue has been here since December and is getting worse. Attempts to put loose grit back in holes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Albany Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole roughly 30x16x5 cm, 2nd January
item.description:
Outside 12 Albany Road This is outside my house and I have filled some of it with loose grit to stop it being so deep. I am reporting a number of potholes along Albany Road. The whole road needs resurfacing due to the number of potholes existing and the number of potholes developing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Albany Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low overhanging street tree branches catching vehicles using driveway and wood falling on drive, 2nd January
item.description:
The street tree has low branches which are overhanging the driveway and catching and scraping vehicles it. Wood is continually dropping on the driveway. This was reported in September 2024 and over a year later has not been fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, The Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: PLEASE NOTE, this is a possible burst water main or, natural spring working to the surface, 2nd January
item.description:
Location: Cheltenham, GL50 1SW adjacent to bus stop at exit of Montpellier Gardens, opposite The Ivy restaurant. Either: a burst water main, or a natural spring, is seeping up between the paving slabs of the pavement adjacent to the bus stop, bringing up gravel with it. IN THE CURRENT WEATHER CONDITIONS, THIS WILL BE LETHAL TO PEDESTRIANS WHEN IT FREEZES OVERNIGHT. **PLEASE DEAL WITH ASAP FOR THIS REASON**. Duration of issue unknown. nb Issue has also been reported by phone to 08000 514 514 02/02/2026 13.10h
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Finchcroft Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
